article_title: Supreme Court Rules On Sports Issues
article_text:
The Supreme Court of the United States (SCOTUS to the nerdy political set) has had a busy and notable week. The nine robe-wearing justices issued important decisions in the area of Obamacare, same sex marriage and affordable housing.

SCOTUS, of course, takes on other cases that don’t make heads explode on Fox News. These other, lesser, cases are important and notable in their own right.

We at SportsGrid have scoured the docket for such cases and we found several cases dealing with sports. (Not really, but play along). The court has issued wide-ranging and game-changing rulings that might change the landscape of sports for decades to come.

Among the notable cases decided by SCOTUS:

article_metadata.description: Fresh from decisions on gay marriage and Obamacare, the Supreme Court handles the most important business -- sports issues.
